properties.details: Chiang Kai-shek was born in Xikou, a town approximately 30 kilometers southwest of downtown Ningbo, in Fenghua.
The Nanjing decade was marked by Chiang Kai-Shek's rule over the Republic of China, which had its capital at Nanjing.
Chiang Kai-shek retreated to Taiwan following the success of the Communists in the Chinese Civil War.
Chiang Kai-shek led the Northern Expedition, a military campaign to unify China under the Kuomintang government.
The Marco Polo Bridge Incident marked the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War, and Chiang Kai-shek's leadership against Japanese aggression.
Chiang Kai-shek attended the Cairo Conference, where discussions on post-war Asia were held among the Allied leaders.
Chiang Kai-shek announced China's victory over Japan and the end of World War II in Asia.
The 228 Incident was an anti-government uprising in Taiwan, which resulted in Chiang Kai-shek's administration imposing martial law.
Chiang Kai-shek's government signed the San Francisco Peace Treaty, which formally ended the war between Japan and the Allied powers.
Chiang Kai-shek passed away in Taipei, Taiwan.
